newsitem.title: ISRAEL: Healthcare Tech Q4 net loss narrows.
newsitem.headline: Healthcare Tech Q4 net loss narrows.

text.p: (in thousands of dollars except per share)
The company said the smaller net loss in the fourth quarter of 1996 reflected the impact of several one-time items in the fourth quarter of 1995.

The company attributed the decline in full year gross profit to amortisation expenses related to expired kits and components, a devaluation of the yen, and a change in the mix of products sold towards lower-margin products.
The operating loss for the year after amortisation of goodwill was $2.63 million.
Operating losses were affected by expenses associated with the company's personnel and organisational changes, including the replacement of senior management both in the Israeli and U.S. facilities.
